metadata.title: CVE-2017-5615 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
cgiemail and cgiecho allow remote attackers to inject HTTP headers via anewline character in the redirect location.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgiemail - 1.6-37+deb7u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cgiemail package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6-37+deb7u1build0.16.04.1').
